ЁЯП░
Founder of Devagiri

Bhillama V freed the Seuna (Yadava) dynasty from the subordination of the Chalukyas and established an independent empire. He founded the city of Devagiri and made it his capital. The fort of Devagiri is considered one of the most impregnable forts in India.

тЪФя╕П
Conflict with Hoysalas

He had a fierce struggle with the Hoysala king Ballala II. He faced defeat in the Battle of Gadag (Lakkundi) in 1192 CE, making the Tungabhadra river the boundary between the two states.
